title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Unacceptable: Contains nothing that earns credit

o Completely irrelevant to the stimulus

o Not in Chinese characters

o Blank

Very Weak: Demonstrates lack of competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Response incomplete and difficult to follow; lacks narrative elements; may be inconsistent with stimulus

o Lacks organization and coherence; very disjointed sentences or isolated words

· Delivery

o Constant use of register inappropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Insufficient, inappropriate vocabulary, with frequent errors that significantly obscure meaning; constant interference from another language

o Little or no control of grammatical structures, with frequent errors that significantly obscure meaning

Weak: Suggests lack of competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Response characterized by description or listing, with little narration; may be inconsistent with stimulus

o Scattered information generally lacks organization and coherence; minimal or no use of transitional elements and cohesive devices; fragmented sentences

· Delivery

o Frequent use of register inappropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Minimal appropriate vocabulary, with frequent errors that obscure meaning; repeated interference from another language

o Limited grammatical structures, with frequent errors that obscure meaning

Adequate: Suggests emerging competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Narration tells a basic story consistent with stimulus but may have inconsistencies in its logical progression from beginning to end

o Portions may lack organization or coherence; infrequent use of transitional elements and cohesive devices; disconnected sentences

· Delivery

o Use of register appropriate to situation is inconsistent or includes many errors

· Language Use

o Limited appropriate vocabulary and idioms, with frequent errors that sometimes obscure meaning; intermittent interference from another language

o Mostly simple grammatical structures, with frequent errors that sometimes obscure meaning

Good: Demonstrates competence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Narration tells a complete story consistent with stimulus but may lack detail or elaboration or have minor inconsistencies in its logical progression from beginning to end

o Generally organized and coherent; use of transitional elements and cohesive devices may be inconsistent; discourse of paragraph length, although sentences may be loosely connected

· Delivery

o May include several lapses in otherwise consistent use of register appropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Mostly appropriate vocabulary and idioms, with errors that do not generally obscure meaning

o Mostly appropriate grammatical structures, with errors that do not generally obscure meaning

Very good: Suggests excellence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Narration includes a beginning, middle, and end that tell a logical and complete story consistent with stimulus

o Well organized and coherent, with a progression of ideas that is generally clear; some use of transitional elements and cohesive devices; connected discourse of paragraph length

· Delivery

o Consistent use of register appropriate to situation except for occasional lapses

· Language Use

o Appropriate vocabulary and idioms, with sporadic errors

o Variety of grammatical structures, with sporadic errors

Excellent: Demonstrates excellence in presentational writing

· Task Completion

o Narration includes a thorough and detailed beginning, middle, and end that tell a logical and complete story consistent with stimulus

o Well organized and coherent, with a clear progression of ideas; use of appropriate transitional elements and cohesive devices; well-connected discourse of paragraph length

· Delivery

o Consistent use of register appropriate to situation

· Language Use

o Rich and appropriate vocabulary and idioms, with minimal errors

o Wide range of grammatical structures, with minimal errors
